description:
Turnover: Volume index

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
42152 Indices of turnover in manufacturing

Definition:
The index calculation is based on the total of final invoice
amounts of the reference month (in a breakdown by the sales
directions "domestic territory" and "foreign countries").
This total of values is related to the relevant monthly
average in the base year. To calculate the volume index, the
data are deflated using the producer price indices or the
export price indices. These volume indices are used to
measure the price-adjusted development of demand.
The individual indices for economic branches are aggregated
to form indices for "manufacturing" and for its main
industrial groupings. This is done by means of the
proportions of the turnover values in the base year.
